comment: Works on Motorola Droid Mini.  Very cool app.  I would like to try and DF power line noise using this app coupled with the RTL-SDR dongle.  nice job on the app!

title: The most fun you can have with a dongle ;-)
comment: Works perfectly with my Oneplus One and a generic RTL-SDR dongle. Well worth paying a few pence for to support the author.

title: Does not work
comment: Did not work with my rtl-sdr
Hi Kevin, could you please contact me by mail (dennis.mantz@googlemail.com) I would like to help you with this issue. I'm sure we'll get it working for you! Cheers, Dennis

title: Works ok
comment: Please improve tuning... Add possibility to tune like PC SDR software by flipping digit up/down. Currently it's too many taps to fine-tune
Do not work I tried it don't work please help me and do I need a another piece of equipment other than cell phone I have a Samsung  S3  with  Boost Mobile

Hi Teddy, could you please contact me and tell me what happens when you use the app? Either create an issue on GitHub or write me an email (dennis.mantz@googlemail.com). I'm sure we can find the problem and fix it! Cheers Dennis

title: Great app!
comment: Works flawlessly on my Samsung galaxy S5.
Works great. Thanks!

title: Great app
comment: Works well

title: Working great with RTL
comment: Great job! This is working great with my RTL SDR. Well worth the money! Keep up the great work dev!

title: Cool App
comment: Works great on my Galaxy Note 4 and Galaxy Tab Pro with my HackRF One. I've not yet tested with my RTL-SDR..

title: Works well
comment: Works as advertised. Thanks to the dev for the hard work.
How do I change sample on the app rate I am using a remote server

Hi Steven,
the sample rate is automatically adjusted when you zoom out or zoom in. Except when demodulation is active. Then the sample rate is fixed to 1MHz.

title: Works on Nexus 9
comment: Perfectly works on Nexus 9 with RTL-SDR!

title: Great App - Snags with Kitkat
comment: Worked fine on Jellybean but started throwing snags after upgrade. Will try logging and send it to the Author...

title: Awesome and epic
comment: This application is awesome.  This worked with my USB dongle.

title: Really cool gadget for RF engineers
comment: Restarts driver when changing orientation. Please fix that. Additionally would like to have MUTE button alongside with other buttons. Another issue is: let user choose whether he/she wants kHz, MHz or GHz when entering freq. Thanks in advance!

title: Very useful
comment: Works as shown

title: Awesome work - thanks for open sourcing!
comment: So happy to discover this project. Thank you so much for the first GPL open source Android sdr spectrum explorer I've seen.  Very exciting. It's also great that you've made it easy to put a $ in the tip jar via the app store.  I'm really jazzed about RF Explorer!  Keep up the great work!  Other features it would be wonderful to see in future versions (these would be icing on the cake!): - DC offset correction - Audio gain control - (maybe even audio spectrum display?)

title: Amazing!!!
comment: Works like a charm! Nice feature to save recordings into file. Would be even better to transmit from file on HackRF! 73 SQ7MHZ

title: Xperia Z Tablet
comment: Grabbed the app to play around with RTL SDR. Better signal clarity than SDR# on my laptop. Very happy so far with $15 total investment.  Dongle powered up straight from the tablet. Don't have a HackRF to test.

title: Awesome.
comment: Works well on Amiko A3, OnePlus One/CM11 using RTL-SDR. Bargain price!
Great little analyzer and demodulator!

title: The real deal
comment: Outstanding

title: Pretty cool
comment: Reset the driver/itself when going from landscape to portrait and vice versa
Works ok, have a bug it seems, switching modes am to fm the sound disappears, if u restart the app, sound is back, until i change modes again. I9505 on kitkat. Other than that its a usefull app.

This is weird.. I never experienced anything like this by myself. Maybe you could send me the logfile after the bug happened to you? You can activate logging under Settings, Advanced Settings. There is also the option to view the log. Just send it to dennis.mantz@googlemail.com. I won't post any sensitive info in the logs in public! Cheers Dennis

title: Amazing
comment: Love the added demos now.  Using mine with hackrf.  Also tested with RTL.  Both work perfectly!  Thanks for a great implementation.

title: Excellent job
comment: This app works great. No head aches , no yelling. I followed the instructions, downloaded the driver. My rtlsdr worked not a single problem. I can't get any rtlsdr to work on my desk tops. Thank you oh great one!

title: Works Great
comment: App works well with rtl-sdr usb dongle except that it has a much more restricted freq range than a competitors app with the same dongle. Possibly a user error.  Ie can not tune below 24Mhz.  Get out of range error.  Hoping this is user error as the support and upgrade path from this dev appears to be much better than competitors app. UPDATE: After response from Dev. it appears that the app is correct the tuner in my dongle has a24MHz lower limit,  The  competitors app appears to tune much lower ( doesn't throw error and has signals) but it is not actually tuning lower.  After purchase support for this app is superb.  Can't wait for future updates.  Thank You

First of all thanks for your report! It looks like you own a R820T? As far as I know their lower frequency boundary is 24MHz.. What is the lowest frequency you are able to tune to (and actually receive signals) with your dongle. Maybe I have to adjust this lower boundary in RF Analyzer. Cheers Dennis

title: Excellent app
comment: Works great on my Note 8.0 and with a powered micro-usb-hub works on my Z3 compact too. Looking forward to scanning and would love to see audio recording added. Thanks :-)
Thx! Both requested features are at the top of my todo list ;) I just need some more time. Scanning is a complex feature and I have a lot of other things going on right now, too...

title: Nexus 10 works well
comment: Great app, works well on my Nexus 10.

title: Superb on Tesco Hudl 2
comment: Worked first time with RTL dongle and pre-installed driver from Martin Marinov

title: Definitely worth $0.99
comment: Only $0.99! Since the developer is quickly listening to user feedback - this app is probably going to be better than SDR Touch very soon! I have two wishes - Material Design, and remove the screen orientation settings to use Android's settings. Update: one of those wishes has already come true! The logo and name of the app is missing from the top right corner, though.

SSB and CW will come soon! I'm currently working on recording... but additional modulation modes are my next milestone after that!

UPDATE: single side band (USB and LSB) are now supported in the latest version (1.10)

title: Awesome app
comment: Just what I've been looking for.

title: Works as advertised...
comment: You need to be aware of the power requirements (you CAN work around them, mind) but past that, the devices I tested with RTL-SDR worked like a charm.  Nexus 10 Acer A500  Haven't tested my GNex yet or my S4, but I strongly suspect they're going to work too.  If you want high performance, use the HackRF device.  The RTL-SDR device works well for what it is, but for $5-15 dollars on eBay, it's hardly got the scope and ability of HackRF.  This is a FOSS project.  Like the author says, you can get it for free on the website and sideload.  What do you get for the $1.01 you pay here on Play?  Simple.  Ease of loading the program and you put a bit in the tip jar.  I did...I'm not regretting it.
Thank you! Nice to hear that it works well for you ;)

title: Only Hack RF
comment: That sucks.  Fortunately I only wasted a buck.
It supports HackRF and RTL-SDR (it is clearly described in the app description). In the future I might also support the Airspy. Which hardware would you like to use with it?

title: Great app, great developer
comment: Developer is on point and is working to resolve my issue (I'm a rogue with a jawbreaker). In the meantime, working flawless with my RTL-SDR =]

title: Off to a good start and thanks for hackrf on android
comment: Thanks so much to Dennis for making something for the hackrf on android. It's early days and I got warbly slightly slowish sounding  WFM here right now on Motorola xoom tablet M601 and it lacks sensitivity a lot, but cannot wait for refinements and SSB etc. Update for v1.11 on a freshly installed factory rom XOOM it now stops every time I try to tune by swiping screen, also audio is crackly, FFTset to 2049. Also stops when I change gain settings

Thanks for the bug report! I will investigate this issue. Could you send me the log file after the app stops working? You can enable logging and view the log file under settings - advanced settings. Just sent me the file to dennis.mantz@googlemail.com. That would help me a lot! Sorry for the inconvenience!

title: Work's well
comment: Work's pretty well so far! Especially liking the n/wFM and AM demodulation. Works on lollipop on the nexus 5 now.

So it seems it works with the regular 5.0 OTA update. At least with Nexus 5 & 7. Nexus 9 doesn't work at this time (for unknown reasons): https://github.com/demantz/hackrf_android/issues/2#issuecomment-63219353

title: Awesome Developer
comment: I told you on github I would buy the app to support your efforts Dennis, so I did. I haven't been able to use it yet since my dongle died and the new one still isn't here but will update review when I can. Thanks for making this an opensource project and for your excellent support.

thx for the support, hope your dongle will arrive soon! I've uploaded an IQ file of the FM band yesterday so people could test the app without hardware (just choose file source):
http://goo.gl/ymwYVB

I also have a recording at around 410 MHz where you can hear some taxi drivers (NFM at 410.285MHz and another at 410.51MHz):
http://goo.gl/mp0le0

title: Works as Advertised on a generic Dragon Touch A1X 10.1"  $60 Tablet
comment: I plugged my HackRF into my cheap tablet and was rewarded by it functioning as advertised.  I am sure the developer is overwelmed by requests for additional bells and whistles so please add a spectrum survey logging functionality comprising frequency, time, and signal-strength written to a, "live" file.  Something along the lines of the OsmocomSDR Spectrum Sensing and RTL-SDR RTL_POWER apps.  I do not need to do any DSP as I just need spectrum survey measurements.  It is a great app and is highly recommended.  A good learning tool to help inspire a new generation of radio enthusiasts.  Keep up the good work Herr Mantz.

Thx! Your idea sounds cool. I might be able to combine this with the scanner feature I am planning to implement... It will probably be in the version after the next because the next version is almost ready to release...

title: Craig
comment: Excellent App works really well. Just a shame my Galaxy S4 Zoom battery aint that good - Looking forward to the future improvements. Shame we can't charge  and use the software eh.  Keep up the good work.

Thx! You might wanna consider buying a Y-OTG cable and a external battery pack.. It's unfortunate that this application drains the battery so fast. It's because the HackRF/RTLSDR gets powered by the Android device and I do expensive operations on the CPU to demodulate the signals...

title: Works well on A1-830 \w RTL-SDR
comment: Thanks for this app!  If I can make a wish I missing: presets, scanning, recording and anti-aliasing font in GUI.

thx! I'm currently working on recording. Presents and scanning are planned for the future (I will focus on more demodulation modes, SSB, CW, etc. first). I'll have a look at anti-aliasing fonts, thx for the hint ;)
Enjoy the app. I hope I can fulfil some of your wishes soon ;)

title: Thanks for adding HackRF to Android
comment: First of all big thanks for adding HackRF to android. I'm running a note 12.2 and it looks like a great app. Works well with a USB OTG cable and my hackRF. I am a little confused though with direct entry of frequency and cant seem to enter values greater than about 7Mhz.

Thx! If you enter a number in the range 0.0 - 7250.0 it will be interpreted as a frequency in MHz. E.g. enter 97.7 and it will tune the HackRF to 97.7MHz. The other option is to enter the frequency in Hz: e.g. enter 410550000 and it will tune the HackRF to 410.55MHz.

I hope this helps, otherwise contact me via email (dennis.mantz@googlemail.com)
Get gqrx working, you'll get 10 stars :) and pls put HackRF_test in the market. As promised ********** :) get it working in nethunter (with audio) 20 stars...

Audio demodulation is coming very soon ;) HackRF_test was really only a testing app with a horrible user interface^^ I will add the recording feature to RF Analyzer in the future and work on a second app to transmit raw captures, audio files and real-time audio from the microphone ;) But one thing after another ...^^

title: Works on the Verizon Samsung S3!
comment: Keep up the good work! Looking forward to be able to listen via headphone or speaker! I'll be watching this project closely!
thx! AM & FM audio demodulation is now supported in the latest version!

title: Great!
comment: Works perfect with Sony Xperia Z2 👍  also works with the new Samsung Galaxy Tab S 10.5
